Authors:
Guan-Xiu Guan, Shu-Yan Liu, Uwe Braun, Penglei Qiu, Jian
Liu, Feng-Yun Zhao, Shu-Rong Tang, Jia-Ni Li
Title:
A cryptic powdery mildew species found on Hieracium
(Asteraceae) : Golovinomyces hieraciorum sp. nov.
Abstract:
The Golovinomyces cichoracearum complex is highly variable
morphologically and causes powdery mildew on a wide range of Asteraceae
(Cichorioideae), including Hieracium spp. and Lapsana communis. A
comprehensive phylogenetic analysis of Golovinomyces in 2013 revealed
that G. cichoracearum s. str. confined to Scorzonera and Tragopogon
(Asteraceae: Lactuceae). To clarify which species of this complex on
Hieracium are present in Europe (Bashkortostan, Germany, and Slovakia)
and parts of Asia (China). Morphological examinations and phylogenetic
analyses of ITS+ 28S rDNA sequences were conducted from 53 powdery
mildew specimens of Hieracium and L. communis. Golovinomyces species on
Hieracium, a previously unidentified as G. cichoracearum, which we
describe here as Golovinomyces hieraciorum. Numerous collections from L.
communis, which had been misidentified as Golovinomyces but were
Podosphaera ergerontis-canadensis or NeoÃ«rysiphe nevoi in Germany
